instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1278 820-3115-B tarts to boot then half way through just shuts off
threads.message: Working on a A1278 MBP with 820-3115-B board that will power up and start to boot.  The display shows the normal Apple logo and progress bar then about half way through the progress bar the machine completely shuts off as if the battery was disconnected.  Board reacts normally to an SMC reset.  There is no indication of liquid damage.  Can someone point me in the right direction ?

threads.title: A1278 820-3115-B tarts to boot then half way through just shuts off
threads.message:
Try to run EFI ASD.
You can also directly try clean ME BIOS...

threads.title: A1278 820-3115-B tarts to boot then half way through just shuts off
threads.message: Tried known good HDD or SATA cable??? This literally sounds like a dead HDD.....

threads.title: A1278 820-3115-B tarts to boot then half way through just shuts off
threads.message:
I forgot to mention, start with external USB OSX through USB.
So you can discard HDD, or software issue.
I recently got one old iMac with same behavior, fixed by reinstalling OSX.

threads.title: A1278 820-3115-B tarts to boot then half way through just shuts off
threads.message: Turns out it was the HDD connector cable.  Replaced and now the system boots fine.
